tweets.html:
Here is my recap of the recap of the recap of the "Mad Men" recaps: Don.

— Adam Sternbergh (@sternbergh) May 21, 2013

No fan of MAD MEN's portrayal of "big black prostitutes" etc... this season but I take comfort knowing Grandma Ida's granddaughter is Oprah.

— Michael Neal (@slapclap) May 22, 2013

We should ban high capacity magazines, starting with Vogue and Modern Bride.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) May 21, 2013

Because I haven't already tortured myself enough today, time to start watching Fox's #Dads pilot.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) May 21, 2013

@AlyssaRosenberg Stay strong. Take breaks, don't be a hero. Remember there are good people and booze waiting for you on the other side.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 21, 2013

Hey, there sure are a lot of TV shows about killing women! And women that are already dead! People must like that!!

— Vanessa Davis (@squintables) May 21, 2013

Microsoft created an Xbox so big that gamers won't have space for another console... Evil. Brilliant. Microsoft. #xboxreveal

— Mike Drucker (@MikeDrucker) May 21, 2013

All this talk about a "relationship" with my TV makes me think there'll be ports for more than just USB and HD cables. #xboxreveal

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) May 21, 2013

Jeremy Gilbert needs a new one. RT @TVMcGee: What if my TV and I break up? Who gets my XBOX? #xboxreval

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) May 21, 2013

"Xbox One will make Community funny again" #xboxreveal

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) May 21, 2013

I'll live-tweet the big roll-out for the new ColecoVision game system later this afternoon.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 21, 2013

FORTY FUCKING YEARS OF VIDEOGAME TECHNOLOGY SO I CAN WATCH THE MOTHERFUCKING PRICE IS RIGHT?

— ZODIAC MOTHERFUCKER (@ZODIAC_MF) May 21, 2013

The Drew Carey graphics are AMAZING. #xboxreveal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) May 21, 2013

And what happens when you get upset, make random gestures, and scream "What the fuck, Xbox?" What does it do then? #XboxReveal

— Joseph Scrimshaw (@JosephScrimshaw) May 21, 2013

Xbox One registration code: 4-8-15-16-23-42. Enter it every 108 minutes. #XboxReveal

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) May 21, 2013

"This is rocket science level stuff" says man selling a product designed to make leisure activity slightly more inconvenient.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) May 21, 2013

300,000 servers. All powered by humans incubated inside liquid pods. #xboxreveal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) May 21, 2013

Essentially, Xbox will eliminate the outside world completely.#xbox1#snackbody#rascalscooter

— Dick Champagne (@DerekSheen) May 21, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Great, now if there's a fly in the house, my XBOX is gonna go nuts. #XBOXOne

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) May 21, 2013

The Xbox One’s always-on Kinect has scanned your living room and, like you, cannot figure out why you have so much but are so unhappy.

— Anthony Carboni (@acarboni) May 22, 2013

What if Xbox One is configured to recognise your voice alone but it goes raspy cuz your DNA is accidentally spliced with a fly's? What then?

— Dan Douglas (@dandouglas) May 22, 2013

Microsoft hired the gif inventor to to give that interview to distract everyone from how horrible XBOX ONE is

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) May 21, 2013

I'm saying it right now - fuck "Jif." GIF TIL I DIE.

— Caitlin Moran (@caitlinmoran) May 21, 2013

I change how I say "gif" each time, just to annoy everyone

— Patrick Dubuque (@euqubud) May 21, 2013

The proper way to pronounce .GIF is "the death of journalism"

— Jack Moore (@jh_moore) May 21, 2013

Fallacy of intent! This settles nothing! MT: @mkung: GIF inventor Steve Wilhite settles it: "It is a soft ‘G,’ pronounced ‘jif.’"

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) May 21, 2013

Twitter is more fired up by "Gif-pronounced-jif" than any other matter. This is real heartlands stuff.

— Caitlin Moran (@caitlinmoran) May 21, 2013

Rob Lowe equally resistant to "Jif" bullshit RT @RobLowe: Csqxw exxxxqped

— Caitlin Moran (@caitlinmoran) May 21, 2013

There is nothing more merica than telling the inventor of something that he's pronouncing it wrong.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) May 21, 2013

Han shot first, and it's pronounced like "gift." We welcome your contribution, but your children have transcended their parents' authority.

— Julian Sanchez (@normative) May 21, 2013

I think I'm having PTSD flashbacks to the last 3 times twitter fought about extension pronunciations

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) May 21, 2013

Let's settle this pronunciation debate once and for all. Observe: http://t.co/f9x6MCEm4F

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) May 21, 2013

the good news about the pronunciation of "GIF" is we never have to say it out loud because internet people don't have friends

— Lana Berry (@Lana) May 21, 2013

If we as a society just collectively decide to pronounce GIF with a hard G, we'd be better off. They are graphics, not peanut butter.

— 🎄Chris Wilson🎄 (@realchriswilson) May 21, 2013

Like "Buscemi," the correct pronunciation of "gif" is what you believe in your heart.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 21, 2013

i pronounce "gin" with a hard g. also "gnat." also "tough." i pronounce everything with a hard g because i'm not a fucking pussy

— slackbot (@pareene) May 21, 2013

It's geef, guys, geef.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) May 21, 2013

"look at me, i have a fancy hat, i drink things out of glasses, i pronounce things correctly ALL THE TIME" - correct pronouncing people

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) May 21, 2013

that's also a quote from people who drink things out of glasses instead of straight from the bottle / can / boxed wine box

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) May 21, 2013

Here are all the words I definitely know how to pronounce: tacos.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) May 21, 2013

How is .gif pronounced? Trick question. You don't pronounce things on the Internet. Only old people still talk out loud.

— Droppo, Laziest Man on Mars (@scratchbomb) May 21, 2013

How many of you are saying "gif" out loud with any regularity anyways? That ain't no way to get laid.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) May 21, 2013

I was saying "Boo-erns." #GIFvsJIF

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) May 21, 2013

Go ahead and pronounce it "jif." It'll make it easier to round you up and put you on a rocket hurtling into the sun.

— Mark Lisanti (@marklisanti) May 21, 2013

Well, I for one am jlad we've finally settled this.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) May 21, 2013

Just because Dr. Frankenstein says his name is pronounced FRONKENSTEEN doesn't mean you have to call pronounce the monster that way.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) May 21, 2013

The fact the GIF debate is still going on after the creator cleared it up is down to Obama's failure to lead.

— Jingelle Blake Rock 🎅🎄❄️ (@abradacabla) May 21, 2013

Yahoo buys Tumblr. GIF is pronounced JIF. Somebody is trying to destroy the internet.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) May 21, 2013

"It is a soft 'G', pronounced 'jif.' End of story." - Joffrey, basically

— Alison Forns (@alisonforns) May 21, 2013

You’re a soft G, bro.

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) May 22, 2013

A bunch of people in this coffee shop just got into a knife fight over the correct pronunciation of GIF. So many ruined skinny jeans.

— A.S. Paul (@aspaul) May 22, 2013

"GIF" is pronounced "JIF" like # is pronounced "Poundtag"

— pizzmoe #TakeAKnee (@pizzmoe) May 22, 2013

The hard G honestly never occurred to me. I am glad to have been proved right. It must feel awful to be proved wrong by science, huh?

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) May 22, 2013

I'd debate you about the proper way to say picture formats, but I don't want to get into a TIFF.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) May 22, 2013

I think we should stop arguing about how to pronounce GIF and focus on replacing a 25 year old image format.

— Dan Winclechter (@DWincl) May 22, 2013

Also: The first two letters in sonar stand for "sound," yet we use the long o. Did people in the 40s argue this? No! They were fighting WWII

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) May 22, 2013

Skype is actually pronounced "sky pie."

— Adam B. Golub (@adamgolub) May 22, 2013

It all comes down to personal preference. Just realize your grandchildren will use the soft G. And speak Chinese. And live in a computer.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) May 22, 2013

.@mattthomas "The Ancient Americans worshipped two deities, a being called GIF, and a kind of shadowy opposite named JIF…"

— Gerry Canavan (@gerrycanavan) May 22, 2013

From henceforth I will pronounce GIF "chafe."

— Adam B. Golub (@adamgolub) May 22, 2013

We're not really going along with the GIF creator's soft-G pronunciation, are we? He is one man. We are everyone else.

— Matt Mitovich (@MattMitovich) May 22, 2013

I've always just said "Skippy." #gif

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) May 22, 2013

Just jo je jon jhe jafe jide, J'm jronouncing jverything jike jis jrom jow jn.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) May 22, 2013

*walks into Twitter*
*looks around*
*eyes widen*
*backs out slowly*

— Jason Sweeney (@sween) May 22, 2013

.gif RT @sween: *walks into Twitter*
*looks around*
*eyes widen*
*backs out slowly*

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) May 22, 2013

all this could be avoided if we just called them "tumblies"

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) May 22, 2013

"What is a GIF?" - Dowager Countess

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) May 22, 2013

I hope everyone who is arguing for a soft G in GIF is also a strict constitutional constructionist

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) May 22, 2013

I don't care how you pronounce it. As long as you can give me Kenny Cosgrove tap-dancing and Pete Campbell falling down stairs, we're money.

— Brian Moritz (@bpmoritz) May 22, 2013

Picturing a modern version of the X-Files where the conspirators keep Mulder and Scully from the truth using only budget cuts.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) May 22, 2013

If you want something RTed, make sure there's a typo. #DerpysLaw

— 🎄manda B🎁wer (@heyprofbow) May 22, 2013

One day some drunk old NBA owner is going to send his golden retriever to the draft lottery.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) May 22, 2013

Arrested Development banana stand promos accidentally make Netflix more money than new season of Arrested Development.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) May 22, 2013

Off to the banana stand! Then maybe to vote. Those should probably be reversed.

— Tim (@rural_juror) May 22, 2013

I am sad to report that, upon further investigation, there is no money in the banana stand.

— Doug Jones won! Yippie. (@Tempdiaries) May 21, 2013

My girlfriend could recognize an actor from Felicity even in full Stormtrooper gear.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) May 22, 2013

Holy Shit Young Jon Hamm on This Episode of Gilmore Girls Dot Tumblr Dot Com

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 22, 2013

#slatepitch me once, shame on you. #slatepitch me twice, shame on ME

— Dan Kois (@dankois) May 22, 2013

I'm so glad Rufus Humphrey is out of my life forever.

— Sarah Heyward (@shinyunicorn) May 22, 2013

T-shirt idea: "Everything I know about Canadian TV I learned from on-screen logos in GIFs made from Torrents originating in Canada."

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) May 22, 2013

“You know, I was reading the Wikipedia page for Tyrion Lannister…” - Me, at a cocktail party, being as fancy as I can possibly be

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) May 22, 2013

The Footloosing! Too good. #Awkward.

Alright #Grimm! Your third season is set up to be your best yet. Don't frak up your momentum ever again!

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) May 22, 2013

I don't even care that Grimm is setting up to steal from Fringe's playbook because it's so damn awesome my knuckles are still white

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) May 22, 2013

Is it just me or has there been very little actual Cat Deeley in these #SYTYCD audition episodes? I demand more Cat!

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) May 22, 2013

Oh man, this kid on #SYTYCD. EXPLOSION OF ADORABLE.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) May 22, 2013

Just tuned into #SYTYCD. The humidity is rather selective around Mary's head, huh?

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) May 22, 2013

I love #SYTYCD so much, guys. I can't even. This family dance is so fucking great.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) May 22, 2013

Well that was delightful. #SYTYCD

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) May 22, 2013

How do I make my phone alarm Mary Murphy's signature #SYTYCD Hot Tamale Train scream because I need that

— Annie Stamell (@stamos) May 22, 2013

I just watched Jay Leno put a lamprey eel on his neck. I should never leave the TV on NBC while I watch a DVD.
